section.title: Known Implementations
section.para:
There are several known implemetations packed along VersionProvider:
Class
Description
AppenderDecoratorVersionProvider
Concatenates an static string to another VersionProvider.
AppenderMultipleVersionProvider
Concatenates multiple VersionProvider if they are valid.
EmptyVersionProvider
Returns always blank text.
InmutableVersionProvider
Returns always the same value, defined at constructions (configurable).
ManifestVersionProvider
VersionProvider which retrieves the version from the java manifest.
Useful to use the version in the MANIFEST.MF while building with hudson.
MultipleVersionProvider
Chained VersionProvider, Useful to try to get a version number without knowing which one will give a valid answer.
PropertiesVersionProvider
VersionProvider which uses a property from Properties.It can get the artifactId version which Maven leaves at META-INF.
ValidatorVersionProvider
This Validates that each VersionProvider complies
Without too many prerequisits, you can easily achieve a VersionProvider combining these Implementations. For example you can easily implement a VersionProvider that:
If there is pom and hudson build version information. uses both
else, if there is only pom version informtion uses it.
else, if there is only build version information uses it.
else it will use the date when the app started.
According to the example the outputs would be in each case.
0.0-SNAPSHOT-build-25
0.0-SNAPSHOT
build-25
11B3D01DFE8

section.title: Spring MVC
section.para:
If you use Spring MVcC commons-web-utils provides you with the necessary beans to start using the previously shown example. In the example below we will see instructions to start using VersionProvider in a common web application.:
Add the following dependencies to your pom: commons-spring y commons-web-utils
Add the following to your spring context:
<import resource="classpath:ar/com/zauber/commons/web/version/version-provider-spring.xml"/>
<import resource="classpath:ar/com/zauber/commons/spring/web/utils/resource-version-provider-spring.xml"/>
And provide the following properties (ie JNDI) :
commons.web.version.manifest.atribute=Hudson-Build-Number
commons.web.version.manifest=META-INF/MANIFEST.MF (where to get hudson build number)
commons.web.version.pom=META-INF/maven/ar.com.zauber.tools.bob/bob-web/pom.properties (where to get artifact version number.)
This component is recommended to be used together with Commons web urifactory here it's an example of how to use an ConfigurableUriFactoryFactoryBean with this.
<bean name="versionString" class="org.springframework.beans.factory.config.MethodInvokingFactoryBean"> <property name="targetObject" ref="versionProvider"> <property name="targetMethod" value="getVersion"/> </bean>
<bean class="ar.com.zauber.commons.web.uri.factory.ConfigurableUriFactoryFactoryBean"> <constructor-arg index="0"> <bean class="ar.com.zauber.commons.web.uri.factory.IdentityUriFactory"/> </constructor-arg> <property name="absoluteUris" value="false"/> <property name="prefixKey" value="http://www.abc.com"/> <property name="version" ref="versionString"/> </bean>
